title: Sr. Finance Transformation Analyst
content:
Req ID: GAQ324R122
Databricks is looking to fill the position of Order to Cash Transformation Analyst reporting to the Director, OTC Finance Transformation. As a strategic owner driving innovation and efficiency at scale, you will partner with the Finance team across Revenue Operations, Billing, Credit & Collections, Technical Accounting, Revenue Assurance and FP&A.
Planning, leading and executing on global, cross-functional, enterprise-wide projects that impact the Finance organization should be your passion. The ability to plan and execute effectively while collaborating across teams and locations will be key to success in this role. In this role you will remove friction for the Finance team by optimizing process and technology improvements. 
You will develop deep knowledge of financial impacting processes in order to identify and build scalable solutions. You will need to build cross-functional relationships and drive results.

Design and improve processes through analysis of current state, capturing pain points/gaps, developing future state process flows, and executing roadmaps
Become a trusted advisor and partner with subject matter experts to understand their goals, processes, and pain points to deliver solutions
Drive standardization of Order-To-Cash processes and identify automation opportunities
Build and support reporting to facilitate Order-to-Cash processes and analyses
Manage end-to-end UAT activities by driving cross-functional coordination, maintaining testing assets, documenting results and guiding solutions
Build and and maintain project plans to track, analyze and communicate project milestones and statuses
Lead all aspects of assigned OTC projects and ensure projects achieve desired goals and benefits, including operational effectiveness, compliance and reporting requirements.
Manage program risks and develop mitigation strategies to meet goals and timelines
Collaborate across the organization, including stakeholder teams, Finance Systems, FP&A, BSE, IT, and the Data Team to understand the requirements of your team and ensure the team has the resources it needs to succeed from project scoping to change management. 

What we look for:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field
5+ years of experience working in Finance or Accounting function
Strong experience in process design, mapping and optimization
Expert-level Microsoft Excel Skills
Experience with data transformation and visualization tools such as Microsoft Power Query and Power BI, Alteryx or Tableau; Experience with SQL and Python a plus
Understanding of global Quote-to-Cash processes including order management, billing, collections, cash application, and revenue recognition
SaaS industry experience
Experience with project management principles and methodologies
About Databricks
Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
 
Compliance
If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.

questions.label: Do you confirm that you are not under any active performance management or disciplinary action?
Do you confirm that you are aware and willing of your responsibility to notify your outgoing manager of your application prior to onsite interview?
Are you authorized to work lawfully in the country where this job is located?
Do you now, or will you in the future, require immigration sponsorship for work authorization in the country where this job is located?

Do you have a minimum of Consistently Meets Exepctations (CME) in your most recent performance cycle? *Please note: cross-department roles may require a higher performance rating of Exceeds Expectations (EE)

Have you been in your currently role for at least 12 months today? (Note: If you were promoted to a new level in the most recent PERF cycle, have a performance rating of CME or higher, and have not changed roles since, you are eligible prior to 12 months.)
